data.text:
1. Monk thelonious Gaddiel and albert and ediel and jessiel and savannah

2. Monk was born on October 10, 1917, in Rocky Mount, North Carolina, As his health declined, Monk's last six years were spent as a guest in the Weehawken, New Jersey, home of his long-standing patron and friend, Pannonica de Koenigswarter, who nursed Monk during his final illness. She proved to be a steadfast presence, as did his own wife Nellie, especially as his life descended into further isolation.[ Monk did not play the piano during this time, even though one was present in his room, and he spoke to few visitors. He died of a stroke on February 17, 1982, and was buried in Ferncliff Cemetery in Hartsdale, New York.

3. thelonious monk where he lived Thelonious was only four when his mother and his two siblings, Marion and Thomas, moved to New York City where he would spend the next five decades of his life.

4. Why was the musician important to jazz Monk's music was known for its humorous, almost playful, quality. He was also one of the most prolific composers in the history of jazz. Many of his compositions, which were generally written in the 12-bar blues or the 32-bar ballad form, became jazz standards.
